organization.title: Sandbag
organization.description:
Sandbag was founded on this simple idea: Put your effort where it makes the biggest impact.
For all of us who see the exciting potential of a clean, renewable future and the corresponding threat of climate change 'meltdown', it can be frustrating that things aren't moving faster. We 'do our bit' but individuals' efforts don't add up to a clean energy revolution.

votings.v_title: An EU greenhouse gas reduction target of 50% by 2030
votings.v_description: To keep the world from warming more than 2C, climate science and effort-sharing models recommend the EU should have greenhouse gas reduction targets of at least -55% by 2030.
Subsidies still support fossil fuels. Money used to support these polluting fuels could be used to support climate  action.
The EU carbon market has been sorely in need of reform for many years now - an agreement to temporarily withhold allowances was a small step in the right direction.
Increasing the share of renewables is crucial in the transition to a low-carbon future. Ambitious targets are needed to secure this as a policy.

votings.v_title: 3 Binding Targets on the EU 2050 Roadmap
votings.v_description: NGO's have called for 3 binding targets on renewable energy, emissions reductions and energy saving measures. It is essential that the agreements are legally binding so that member states cannot escape from their responsibilities.

votings.v_title: Reporting greenhouse gas emissions across Europe
votings.v_description: In order to reduce greenhoues gas emissions across Europe, there must be firm standards for carbon accounting.
Reducing energy consumption is a very effective and cheap way to reduce greenhouse gas emissions along with other benefits.
The EU's 2020 climate targets allows emissions to grow! The targets need to be accordingly more ambitious to take into account current progress.

votings.v_title: Climate finance for the world's poorest
votings.v_description: Developed countries have promised to provide $100bn /yr by 2020 to support developing countries fighting climate change impacts.

votings.v_title: Developing a common EU position ahead of the United Nations Conference on Sustainable Development (Rio+20)
votings.v_description: Climate change will disproportionately impact the world's poorest, so it is essential that climate change considerations are integrated in development policy.

votings.v_title: The EU strategy for the Copenhagen Conference on Climate Change (COP 15)
votings.v_description: A global agreement at Copenhagen in 2009 would have been a big step in the right direction. These hopes ultimately floundered with a weak agreement. The EU position ahead of the conference was important groundwork.
